items.sentence: I am afraid they both have a bad reputation.
I am looking forward to the summer vacation.
I am not as interested in literature as you.
I am sorry I am unable to attend your party.
I am sorry to have kept you waiting so long.
Tom lives 10 miles from the Canadian border.
Tom omitted a couple of items from the list.
I don\'t know whether to turn left or right.
Why should Tom need Mary to do that for him?
Would you be good enough to do that for Tom?
I don\'t want to be late for my first class.
I don\'t want to buy anything in this store.
Since Tom was sick, he didn\'t go to school.
Somebody broke into Tom\'s house last night.
Tom is outside playing frisbee with his dog.
Tom is planting a palm tree in his backyard.
Tom is quite different from what I expected.
Tom is really serious about learning French.
Tom is rich enough to buy whatever he wants.
Tom shouldn\'t say things like that to Mary.
